reviews.text: I stay at this hotel regularly for business. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet. The staff are very courteous and a few even remember my name. The location is on the edge of what I consider the historic district but is still convenient to walk almost anywhere.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Nickeled and Dimed to Death with Extra Fees
reviews.text: Nice hotel, but this is one of those places that nickel and dime you to death with extra fees -- twelve dollars a day to park, ten dollars a day for internet access, eleven dollars a day for a very limited breakfast buffet, etc. etc... -- on top of already pricey accomodations. You would think that a more modern hotel such as this one would have automatic doors in the lobby, but no such luck. I guess that keeps their doormen employed, although we were far from the only guests who managed to avoid their "assistance" with our luggage. After you finish paying all those extra fees, you have nothing left over for tips, not that I need someone to wheel my suitcase for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the hotel has a great location, nice big lobby, and was nicely decorated for Christmas. Staff was friendly, but they also seemed to spend a lot of time socializing with one another in groups, particularly employees who leaned on the front desk to chat with the desk clerks. You had to break up their laugh fests to receive any service. Room was fine, if a bit small, and very little soundproofing between rooms. We heard a large family brawl through the wall next door for two days because one of the youngsters was apparently accused of prematurely unwrapping a Christmas gift, which he vociferously denied -- day and night and day again, complete with lots of door slamming. If they hadn't checked out we would have asked to be moved.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The Renaissance Charleston Hotel was in the perfect location. After arriving early in the day on Friday we parked the car and didn’t use it again until we left. The self parking was $12 a day and the spaces were really tight, however this is the norm for this area. Our room was updated as it had a flat screen TV and new bedding. The view from our standard room left much to be desired just some old roof tops were visible. The bathrooms also were updated and very clean. We did have drinks at the bar both nights before we went out and they were reasonably priced and the bar tenders offered some good insight to the area. I think that my favorite part was the location. It is perfectly placed between King Ave. (All the high end shops) and the Market (Local shops and popular restaurants).
reviews.title: Great Service..great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we travel alot and it has been a long time since I've actually felt I got what I've paid for. Here I did. Great location, clean,well appointed rooms. Very friendly staff. The concierge Brian Farmer was top notch- he made reservations at all the desirable restaurants for us at a moments notice-he got us discounted carriage ride tickets...as efficient as any concierge at any 5 star hotel I've stayed at. The staff just couldn't do enough to accomodate us in any and every way.
reviews.title: Nice stay in the historic district

likes.disliked: — paying for parking and the internet

reviews.text: Stayed at the Renaissance May 14th, 2009. We had two rooms 314 and 313.
reviews.title: NIce but not the cleanest

reviews.text: Front desk staff - wonderful
reviews.title: Great location, great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant staff - wonderful
reviews.title: Anniversary trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - wonderful
reviews.title: Brian the Conceiege made the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness - horrible
reviews.title: Great hotel, and great location. Give it a try.
Great Time in Charleston
reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful trip.....we really enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance.....friendly staff, great room, clean bathrooms...our room was made up promptly each morning....I had been concerned based on some posts here on Trip Advisor... but this is a great place and I would happily stay here again....great city...enjoyed walking just beyond Marion Square on King St. to some terrific restaurants....Fourchette a nice french place...excellent steak and frites....also enjoyed Chai.... a wine and tapas bar with surprisingly good food and a cool jazz band that plays on Thursday nights. Really fun Farmer's Market on Saturday's at Marion Square...gotta check it out....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Renaissance through priceline at $158 a night but was worried after reading a few reviews. Let me remove all worries.
reviews.title: A Renaissance in Charleston

reviews.text: Getting to the Renaissance was a piece of cake; I26 to I526 to Meeting to Wentworth = 16 miles. We checked in with no problems. We elected to self park and was able to stay on the second level of the garage across the street. We then went to room 620. It was large, clean, and very upscale from the robes to the flat panel TV. We were very hungry so, against my norm, we had lunch on the hotel patio. I had the (lump) crab cake sliders. While pricey, they were the best crab cakes I had that weekend.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: After lunch we walked a block down to Meeting. Jestines, a local favorite eatery, is on the corner. We turned went one block north to Society and walked it down to Bay street. We then returned to the hotel turning up Hassel to Meeting back to Wentworth. In this 6 block area, we were able to enjoy many million dollar abodes. They are not the multi million dollar abodes down by Battery Park. But a wonderful lwalk about near the hotel.
reviews.title: Worst experience in a hotel I have ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One block west on Wentworth is King Street. It has all the shopping your wife could ever want to do. That evening we dined at the hotel again. I talked the staff into letting me carry up room service. Normally they were falling all over themselves to help me. But I wanted to earn the points with my wife. :) I had the shrimp grits. I thought they were second to the grits at Jestines but my wife liked them better.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our pre-cruise stay at the Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has managed to incorporate some of Charleston's charm into its wonderful, quirky decor. It's a delight to stay in and we plan to return.
reviews.title: Charming, wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel - quiet. we had a nice room with a balcony. This part of town is quieter. Recommend this hotel - clean and nice staff.
reviews.title: Good hotel, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a weekend trip to Charleston and a three-night stay at the Renaissance Marriott. We could not have had a better stay. The location of the hotel is second to none as it is less than a block off both King Street and Meeting Street. All the great attractions in Charleston are within walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip was made great because of the help from Suzanne, the Concierge at the Marriott. She made great recommendations for things to do, places to eat, etc. We took her up on all of her recommendations and enjoyed all of them. Our favorite activity was Tommy Dew's Walking Tour. Tommy is incredibly insightful and provocative.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff, good choice overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend the Renaissance Marriott to anyone wanting to go to Charleston. It definitely helped that we got a great rate through Priceline. Without that, the price might have been a little too high.
reviews.title: Seriously mixed review

likes.disliked: — Missing features from our package, unhelpful people at the reception
